title: Technology Carbon Standard
description: The Technology Carbon Standard is a standard for measuring and managing the carbon emissions of technology products and services.

upstream_emissions.description: Upstream emissions relating to the embodied carbon of hardware and the development of software.

software.description: The carbon emissions of software products and services. (kgCO2e)

employee_hardware.description: The embodied carbon emissions of employee hardware. (kgCO2e)

network_hardware.description: The embodied carbon emissions of network hardware. (kgCO2e)

server_hardware.description: The embodied carbon emissions of server hardware. (kgCO2e)

direct_emissions.description: Direct running costs that are attributed to the electricity powering servers, networks and devices.

onsite_employee_hardware.description: The operational carbon emissions of employee equipment (kgCO2e).

networking.description: The operational carbon emissions of networking equipment. (kgCO2e)

servers.description: The operational carbon emissions of servers. (kgCO2e)

generators.description: The operational carbon emissions of generators. (kgCO2e)

indirect_emissions.description: Indirect running carbon costs that are attributed to external hardware and service solutions.

offsite_employee_hardware.description: The operational carbon emissions of employee equipment offsite (kgCO2e).

cloud_services.description: The operational carbon emissions of cloud services (kgCO2e).

saas.description: The operational carbon emissions of SaaS products and services (kgCO2e).

managed_services.description: The operational carbon emissions of managed services (kgCO2e).

downstream_emissions.description: Carbon associated with the use of products and services produced by the business.

end_user_devices.description: The carbon emissions of end user devices (kgCO2e).

network_data_transfer.description: The carbon emissions of network data transfer (kgCO2e).
